posts.name: Andy
posts.cooked: Signal posts some updates on his Twitter profile, but I think it would be interesting to post these updates also on Mastodon and Drakkle

Hi, with the recent news about Twitter going private, a lot of users are flocking off the platform and getting started with Mastodon. Would it make sense for Signal to create an official account on Mastodon?

P.S.: I‚Äôm not looking for an official answer from the Signal team, just probing to see where the community stands on this.

posts.name: Liam
posts.cooked: How about Vero or MeWe? Mastodon is apparently an unsure one.

posts.name: PoPoL
posts.cooked:
9djdk:

flocking off the platform and getting started with Mastodon

https://twitter.com/joinmastodon/status/1519157267857293312

These are not very significant numbers at all, kind of telling that they think it is.

16M a year if that rate even continues and they keep a significant portion of the new users.

I think those are just new signups. A portion of users already had Mastodon accounts but weren‚Äôt using them until the Twitter news hit. Monthly active users across the network is approaching 400K.

However, I agree it‚Äôs unlikely that it would even get close to Twitter numbers. The Signal team isn‚Äôt overly active on Twitter to begin with, so it might not make sense for them to be on yet another social media platform.

Mastodon ‚Äì 28 Apr 22

Eugen Rochko (@Gargron@mastodon.social)

We have now collectively gained 112,413 monthly active users in the last few days, and 149,720 compared to the end of March. That's a 62% increase. Total now at 384K MAU across Mastodon.

link_counts.title: Eugen: "We have now collectively gained 112,413 monthly a‚Ä¶" - Mastodon

posts.name: PoPoL
posts.cooked:
9djdk:

I think those are just new signups.

Yeah I know that.

9djdk:

Monthly active users across the network is approaching 400K.

Where‚Äôs that from?

See the creator‚Äôs post I linked above. There are also some sites that aggregate stats across all instances like:

mastodon.help

Mastodon Help - Instances

Mastodon instances

fedidb.org

FediDB - Developer Tools for ActivityPub

Developer Tools for ActivityPub

posts.name: PoPoL
posts.cooked:
I see I missed that.

Well to your original point, that they should have a presence on mastodon: They have always been anti-federation, here‚Äôs a blog post on that, and you would easily find more examples.

I can‚Äôt see anyway they would use the complete opposite model to promote their own without opening themselves up to constant barrage of calls to provide a bridge between the two as others have briefly had working in the past.

link_counts.title: Signal >> Blog >> Reflections: The ecosystem is moving
Twitter to mastodon bridge is not well configured

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
Signal should have a presence on the fediverse, I would suggest Friendica instead of Mastodon.
Why? Because in Friendica you can setup an account as a public forum. That may help people to seek help easily.

Hubzilla/Zap also have a forum feature, however I personally like Friendica.

posts.name: PoPoL
posts.cooked:
ponytail:

Signal should have a presence on the fediverse

Interested, why do you think so?

Oh that‚Äôs a good point!

Yeah, I‚Äôm familiar with Moxie‚Äôs stance on decentralization. Although, Signal maintaining a presence on a decentralized platform wouldn‚Äôt necessarily mean that they endorse decentralization. It could be a sign of support towards an open-source alternative to Twitter. One could argue that Mastodon is to Twitter what Signal is to Whatsapp.
They would then have 2 forums though: this one and Friendica‚Äôs. It could become confusing to users. Better to stick to one forum to collect user feedback and provide official support.

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
PoPoL:

I can‚Äôt see anyway they would use the complete opposite model to promote their own without opening themselves up to constant barrage of calls to provide a bridge between the two as others have briefly had working in the past .

Neither does Signal promote collecting tons of user data, but still, they are on Instagram and Twitter.
You don‚Äôt have to be on Mastodon only because you are pro federation.

PoPoL:
ponytail:

Signal should have a presence on the fediverse

Interested, why do you think so?

Because there are many people on the fediverse who use Signal, and having an account there will allow them to communicate with the service they use daily, intact with their posts, share them and share suggestions, etc.

There are many people I would like to follow on the fediverse, unfortunately then don‚Äôt have an account there, so I still keep my Twitter account active. Just like I am on WhatsApp because not everyone is on Signal.

Being on fediverse will be a sign of support and will allow people to adopt it easily.

9djdk:

They would then have 2 forums though: this one and Friendica‚Äôs. It could become confusing to users. Better to stick to one forum to collect user feedback and provide official support.

There is a Signal community on Reddit, Discussions happen on GitHub as well, there are many Signal Discussion rooms on Matrix, and who know there will IRC or XMPP chatrooms as well for Signal.

There can be one official place for support, and many unofficial ones. Having another place where people can ask for help is not a downside. In fact, it will allow them to ask for help without creating a new account here or on Reddit or Matrix, etc.

posts.name: PoPoL
posts.cooked:
ponytail:

Neither does Signal promote collecting tons of user data, but still, they are on Instagram and Twitter.

And no one is calling on them to join them and collect data themselves, they just say ‚Äúwhen usernames?‚Äù, ‚Äúwhy phone number?‚Äù etc. in the replies. But if they are on fediverse, it‚Äôll be pure ‚Äúwhen federation?‚Äù in the replies.

ponytail:

Being on fediverse will be a sign of support and will allow people to adopt it easily.

Well that‚Äôs exactly my point, they don‚Äôt support it and joining it in anyway given their blogs would be hypocritical or they would otherwise have to explain why their position on it has changed.

Being on Twitter/Instagram on the other hand isn‚Äôt hypocritical because they are on there mostly saying ‚Äúwe‚Äôre better then this‚Äù and are just advertising.

In summary, showing up on a little used platform for advertising doesn‚Äôt make sense, so, as you say yourself, would show support more than anything else, and that just leaves an indefensible position against ‚Äúif you support this then why don‚Äôt you join this?‚Äù

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
PoPoL:

‚Äúwhen usernames?‚Äù, ‚Äúwhy phone number?‚Äù

True

PoPoL:

‚Äúif you support this then why don‚Äôt you join this?‚Äù

Not always people join/use fediverse because they support federation, some just want an alternative.

Mastodon ‚Äì 1 May 22

Nick Schiwy (@ItsSheVee@mastodon.social)

Why did you end up coming to Mastodon? Pls boost so we can get some good data üôå [ ] Elon [ ] Fear of bird app going crazy w/o moderation [ ] Love of open-source [ ] Other (please reply!)

link_counts.title: Nick Schiwy: "Why did you end up coming to Mastodon? Pls boost ‚Ä¶" - Mastodon

posts.cooked:
Hello,

I‚Äôd wish Signal would‚Äôve a presence in the Fediverse for e.g. on Mastodon. Especially for privacy concerned users this would be helpful. Also, after Elon Musk‚Äôs Twitter ‚Äúscandal‚Äù I know many people that deleted their Twitter and switched to the Fediverse (most people switched to Mastodon). Signal could create an account in the Fediverse and post announcements there. It‚Äôs also possible using a free service to cross-post from Mastodon to Twitter.

Mastodon also allows a company to self-verify by embedding a link tag into their website. Linking the website on their profile on Mastodon will then lead to a verification checkmark, so users can see that the Signal account is the real account.

More information about Mastodon can be found here: https://joinmastodon.org/

Official accounts that are present in the Fediverse include for e.g.:

  • The EU with several accounts
  • The German government with several accounts
  • Thunderbird
  • KDE
  • Bitwarden
  • LibreOffice
  • Inkscape
  • The TOR project

and many more. Because of the user growth in the Fediverse and because of the presence of other big projects and organizations it would be awesome to see Signal in the Fediverse so people that are privacy concerned and therefore don‚Äôt use Twitter and/or Instagram can follow Signal on there.

link_counts.title: Giving social networking back to you - Mastodon

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Also, after Elon Musk‚Äôs Twitter ‚Äúscandal‚Äù I know many people that deleted their Twitter

I‚Äôm reconsidering my twitter use after his takeover, but that would probably be the other way around. If he manages to get rid of the anti-conservative censorship on twitter I might start using it again.

So I fully approve this suggestion
